an7.65:4.1: “Mendicants, when there is no conscience and prudence, one who lacks conscience and prudence has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint.
an7.65:4.2: When there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an7.65:4.3: When there is no ethical conduct, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an7.65:4.4: When there is no right samādhi, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an7.65:4.5: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an7.65:4.6: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an7.65:4.7: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an7.65:4.8: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an7.65:4.9: In the same way, when there is no conscience and prudence, a person who lacks conscience and prudence has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint.
an7.65:4.10: When there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an7.65:4.11: When there is no ethical conduct, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an7.65:4.12: When there is no right samādhi, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an7.65:4.13: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an7.65:4.14: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an7.65:5.1: When there is conscience and prudence, a person who has fulfilled conscience and prudence has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
an7.65:5.2: When there is sense restraint, one who has fulfilled sense restraint has fulfilled a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an7.65:5.3: When there is ethical conduct, one who has fulfilled ethical conduct has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an7.65:5.4: When there is right stillness, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an7.65:5.5: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an7.65:5.6: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an7.65:5.7: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an7.65:5.8: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an7.65:5.9: In the same way, when there is conscience and prudence, a person who has fulfilled conscience and prudence has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint. …
an7.65:5.10: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
